page.title: 05FARMING Local Changes (2)
page.content: During the Second World War farms were encouraged and after the war the Government poured money into them. Farms were expanded and much food was produced.Bigger machines were used so fewer people were needed. Farm cottages became weekend or holiday homes for towspeople.Others moved into the village but worked in the cities. Today farms are reducing their produce.Big farms specialize whilst small farms turn to other things. Sharlands a farm 60 to 70 years old,was a mixed farm with cattle,but now they produce"Pick Your Own Fruit", have a pottery,run painting classes and have a swimming pool open to the public. At Brownings Farm the barns have been taken over as craft shops: there is a pottery,picture framing and weaving. An ornamental blacksmith now works in the old milking parlour.
